subject: Re: [junit] Will someone please respond?
msgSnippet: You re right.  Since you pay good money for this service, you deserve more.  Perhaps you should complain to the management. You got one thoughtful, articulate
messageBody:
You're right. Since you pay good money for this service, you deserve
more. Perhaps you should complain to the management.

You got one thoughtful, articulate response. Since you did not send a
follow up with any more detailed response, it is natural for the group to
assume that this resolved the issue for you.

At 03:24 PM 12/27/2001 +0000, you wrote:
>Would someone please take a look at a posting from me on the JUNIT group a
>two days ago.
>It concerns how to test a method that uses jOptionPane. I got one reply.
>
>In the meantime, what else got a response? Well, we seem to have time to
>respond to trivial subjects and partake
>in what is nothing short of mental masturbation and ignore substantive
>questions that require some effort.
>I think I have read about 30 messages about getters and setters that
>sounds more like a pissing contest. And then there is the chatter about
>one piece of spam. How many worthless messages did this "spam"
>generate? Boy we nailed that one didn't we?
>
>If you need someone to chat with, get a dog. I got one, he just doesn't
>know java/junit...yet.
>
>Sorry for the vent but I grow tired of groping in the dark.
>
>Thanks for your help.
>
>Lee Chalupa
>
>
>
>
>To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
>junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com
>
>
>Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/

David Olivier
Naval Research Laboratory
Digital Mapping, Charting & Geodesy Analysis Program
